authors.name: ereisner
authors.affiliation: Center for Epigenomics, University of California, San Diego

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6b8li","text":"This protocol describes isolation of nuclei from frozen tissue using gentleMACS homogenization and FANS. Nuclei are permeabilized, washed, and counted; single-nucleus suspensions of sufficient concentration and nuclei quality may then be processed using the Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression (CG000338, Rev F) protocol from 10X Genomics.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

documents.ofn: Nuclei Preparation from Frozen Tissue for 10X Multiome using gentleMACS Homogenization and FANS, v1.2, Feb 2024.pdf

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ug87","text":"Pre-chill a large, swing-bucket tabletop centrifuge to 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fcvg9","text":"Add the pre-determined homogenization volume of MACS buffer to each MACS tube on ice. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1cn9l","text":"Immediately transfer samples to MACS tubes. If needed, resuspend tissue first with MACS buffer from the MACS tube and then transfer the full volume to the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"abmgm","text":"Tighten the cap of each MACS tube and flip the tube upside down. Ensure that all tissue is submerged in the buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ae8k9","text":"Thaw on ice for 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7hosi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"90a2k","text":"Homogenize samples using the gentleMACS Octo Dissociator in the 4 °C cold room.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"f4mv3","text":"Run the protocol “protein_01_01” for gentleMACS M tubes (~1 min).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"erdnn","text":"Quick spin M tubes to bring all liquid to the bottom of the tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8sjd7","text":"Filter each sample into a 15 mL tube using a 30 um (green) Celltrics filter. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ftmfk","text":"Rinse the sides of each MACS tube with 1 mL MACS buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6pv7o","text":"Quick spin M tubes to bring all liquid to the bottom of the tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"bum16","text":"Transfer the rinse to each Celltrics filter.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cruaq","text":"Centrifuge homogenized samples for 5 min at 500 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fnfc3","text":"Discard supernatants. A small volume of supernatant can be left in each tube to avoid disturbing the pellet.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7e65a","text":"Gently resuspend each pellet in 500 µL sort buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"vuva","text":"Transfer the full sample volume to a pre-chilled 1.5 mL LoBind tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"3taro","text":"Incubate on ice, protected from light, for 10 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e6u3l","text":"Aliquot 90 uL of 5X collection buffer into a 1.5 mL LoBind tube for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"825vr","text":"Sort 120,000 nuclei into the 90 µL of collection buffer for each sample.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4gr6f","text":"Centrifuge for 5 min at 500 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1be5d","text":"Discard supernatant.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4qhcj","text":"Gently resuspend pellet in 100 µL of NPB.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"87ku","text":"Incubate on ice for 1 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"chhem","text":"Add 900 µL of Wash buffer to each sample","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7fqio","text":"Centrifuge for 5 min at 500 rcf, 4°C, and 3/3 acceleration/deceleration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9upoc","text":"Carefully discard supernatants. Switch to a P20 pipette once the volume reaches ~40 µL. Do NOT disturb the pellet. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d6l16","text":"Gently resuspend in 12 μL of 1X Nuclei Buffer (prepared from 10X Genomics protocol).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bokh2","text":"Stain an aliquot of nuclei with 0.4% Trypan Blue. Load 10 μL into one chamber of a hemocytometer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14i6c","text":"Count nuclei in four quadrants. Average the count and determine the nuclei concentration (nuclei/μL).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ug99","text":"Capture images from the microscope field at 10X and 20X magnification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f3qse","text":"Follow the 10X Genomics protocol “Chromium Next GEM Single Cell Multiome ATAC + Gene Expression” (CG000338, Rev F) for the remainder of the experiment. Input 18,000 nuclei for each tagmentation reaction for a targeted recovery of ~10,000 nuclei.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":33,"length":81}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Nuclei Preparation from Frozen Tissue for 10X Multiome using gentleMACS Homogenization and FANS, v1.2 Feb 2024
title_html: Nuclei Preparation from Frozen Tissue for 10X Multiome using gentleMACS Homogenization and FANS, v1.2 Feb 2024
